title: 6SS: Arya & Sansa: Weirdo
body:
“What the hell is going on?” Arya stood at the door of her sister’s bedroom, wide eyed looking around, Sansa was sitting crossed legged in her bed, candles had been lit, some music she didn’t understood was playing and there were crystals all over the place.

Sansa opened one eye, “Fix your aura before you get in, I will not accept any sort of negativity in my room today.”

“Uh… ok, listen, just wanted you to know that I’m going with some friends to the movies, want me to bring dinner after?”

“Sure, whatever you want, thank you Arya.”

“Bye,” then whispered, “weirdo.”

From behind the door, Sansa’s voice called out, “I heard that!”

blog.description: a blog dedicated to arya stark and gendry from a song of ice and fire by george r.r. martin and hbo's game of thrones

summary: I should have let the fire have them. Gendry said to, I should have listened. If she hadn’t thrown them that axe they’d all be...
text: I should have let the fire have them. Gendry said to, I should have listened. If she hadn’t thrown them that axe they’d all be dead.

tags: just to be on the safe side
summary: I know that many dany stans think that she will be great friends with arya but I disagree.  They think that Arya and Dany will...
question: I know that many dany stans think that she will be great friends with arya but I disagree.  They think that Arya and Dany will bond about killing slave masters or about Braavos.  I think they are not considering the education Arya is receiving in Braavos.  The Faceless Men with all their abilities DID NOT kill the slave masters in slaver's bay.  I think Arya is going away with the Black and White thinking even if I think Arya will assert her identity and leave the Faceless Men.
answer:
Dear nonny,

the idea that Arya and Dany will get along stems from three hints so to say: in the books Arya flees the Red keep via the deep cellars where the dragon skulls are kept:

This time the monsters did not frighten her. They seemed almost old friends. Arya held the candle over her head. With each step she took, the shadows moved against the walls, as if they were turning to watch her pass. “Dragons,” she whispered. She slid Needle out from under her cloak. The slender blade seemed very small and the dragons very big, yet somehow Arya felt better with steel in her hand.   (AGOT, Arya IV) 

To me it points towards RLJ, that there is one dragon who is friends with Arya (especially since the large skull is probably Balerion which points to Aegon and therefore Jon). In addition Arya keeps her sword Needle close all the time, her Stark identity you could say. So I don’t think this is conclusive for a Da€nerys/Arya friendship.

The other hint is a show-addition: It is revealed that Arya likes Visenya, Aegon the Conqueror’s warlike sister, and this is seen as a sign that she would get along with Da€nerys since she is a Targaryen princess who rides a dragon. But again, this can be understood in another way as well. It might be a hint, that Arya is Visenya, the warrior sister of Aegon who was that protective of her brother that she founded the King’s Guard.

Lastly, both Arya and Da€nerys are seen as fighters against social injustice and as such they should naturally band together. I do think that Arya, who easily befriends people from the smallfolk who has seen the life of the people who suffer the most from war as a first hand experience and who is at the moment in Braavos, a city where the socials boundaries are less rigid than elsewhere, is indeed someone who cares for the smallfolk. This is not necessarily the stand of a social revolutionary, because for Arya it is always about her friends, the people she has empathy for, but there is also a keen sense of justice in Arya. Injustice really gets her riled up and she tries what is in her power to remedy that.

Now I happen to think that Da€nerys as a fighter against social injustice is a huge stretch. Yes, she frees the slaves, but she frees them, because she needs an army and in the books we see her continuing to have slaves of her own, we see her letting Mereen lapse back into slavery (and profiting from it), and in the show we also see her becoming a master, at least in the eyes of former followers (Mhysa is a master) and we see her leaving Essos to conquer Westeros. Leaving the country that does still have slavery to conquer a country that has none with an army that is formed of former slaves - why not continue the good fight against slavery and atone for the sins of her ancestors who were Valyrian slave masters? Again this is a question of interpretation, but I do think that the textual evidence for Da€nerys as the ‘accidental saviour’ who frees slaves because it happens to help her getting troops is better than for her starting an anti-slavery campaign. Her anti-slavery discourse is usually propaganda that serves a goal. Catchy, but ultimately meaningless and inconsequential (’I will break the wheel’ etc.).

So, I don’t think that Arya will fall at Da€nerys’ feet, nor will she stand in awe, braid her hair or even be remotely friendly. She will be suspicious, because after all this is foremost what she has learned. I do think that Arya’s arc is about justice, mercy and revenge and ultimately I think that she will go beyond the ‘black and white’ thinking. She will realise the deeper meaning that is behind Ned’s saying “The man who passes the sentence…” - it is not about having the guts to kill someone after all, it is about weighing the value of a life.

I do think that in the books she will meet Lady Stoneheart and will ultimately reject the fruitless ‘revenge at all costs’ that only serves to weaken all the families involved. She will also learn that death can be mercy and justice as well as revenge and I think she will use her skills to protect her family. I think that when she has completed her learning arc in the books she won’t be hell bent on a killing spree. I think she will be very careful with the gift of death, other than in the show.

It all depends on how we interprete a character. The headcanon Da€nerys of many D stans might indeed befriend Arya, I just happen to think that this Da€nerys is not the one we see in show and books.

Thanks for the ask!

blog.name: kaellecappuccino
blog.title: Kaelle Cappuccino
blog.description: Books. Threads about characters. Analyses of scenes. Metas. Aesthetics.

summary: You know what? I'm bored. So here's GoT characters as.... Mathieu Sommet's lines.
body:
You know what? I’m bored. So here’s GoT characters as…. Mathieu Sommet’s lines.

I know. Plus français tu meurs. BUT HEY IT’S FUNNY.

Tyrion : (english : “It’s not the size that matters. ”)

Sansa : ( english : “But it’s mean to say that !”)

Cersei : (english : “It’s my son! He makes cheese fuck! ”)

Arya : (english : “Will you die at last, mother fucker?” )

White Walkers :

Bran : (“I imagine it’s a kind of court ship ritual… ”)

Sandor : (“I have summoned you because of some humans who take themselves for dogs”)

Daenerys : (“I’m gonna smash you, little shit”)

Varys : (“oh noooo, but it’s tragic ! ”)

Jon : (“I want a kiss! ”)

….

Okay I need sleep.

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

summary: It’s so nice to watch these outcasts of society, the exiles and underdogs come together finally and find love and family.  My...
caption:
It’s so nice to watch these outcasts of society, the exiles and underdogs come together finally and find love and family.

My Lady, My Queen. Beautiful Vid by Tayah K

blog.name: itsgameofthronesimagines
blog.title: Valar Morghulis
blog.description:
Welcome to my Game of Thrones Imagines blog! Here: ships, requests, and fun are all welcome here! One-shots, drabbles, imagines, fake instagram, incorrect quotes, theories, debates, ships, smut are also allowed! Send writing prompt and ship requests! Boy, Girl, etc. Imagines. All sexual orientation and personal likes are welcomed here! Enjoy! (Requests: OPEN!)
Prompts: http://writingexercises.co.uk/dialogue-generator.php

tags: a song of ice and fire
title: Needle’s Legacy
body:
Request: Will you write a fic where Jon finds out from Sansa that Arya was alive from Brienne? Like just a little quick bit that we should’ve gotten in season 6 but they didn’t 🙄. From Jon’s POV where he hears that Arya lived and still had her sword 😌

Note: This will satisfy me as well cause it kind of bugged me that they didn’t do this in Season 6. Feel free to leave more requests like this!

Warning: Short lol

~~~~~~~~~

It was another night where Jon found himself eating by a fire with his sister instead of the rest of the men. Sansa was still exhausted from her restless travel to Castle Black after barely escaping the Bolton’s back at Winterfell. For the moment, Sansa only trusted Jon, Brienne, and Podrick to be around her, so Jon preferred that she ate with him instead of alone.

Keeping herself locked in her room wasn’t necessarily healthy, but Jon understood that she was just trying to heal and feel safe again, so he didn’t force her from anything she was comfortable with. In silence, they sat and ate until one of them could think of something to talk about.

“Do you remember when we would play King of the Rock?” Jon asked her.

He felt triumphant when Sansa smiled at the flames she was staring longingly at, “That was before Rickon was born… before I started playing less and started sewing inside. Robb was always able to pick me up from the rock and set me down on the ground. He used to win all the time. You were just as capable but Robb was stronger and was able to keep the rock for most of the games. And Arya…” she trailed off as a warm feeling floated through her heart and she smiled warmly, “Arya was so little… but still so tough as always. She would stand on that rock and pushed any of us who tried to take it from her into the mud. I remember crying when she did so and that was the last time I played. Robb let her have it, of course, too afraid to pick her up and make her scream.”

Jon huffed in amusement while turning back to stare into the fire, his smile not quite reaching his eyes. The smile slowly faded however as dark thoughts entered his mind and he sighs, “I can’t even start to imagine what might have happened to her…”

Sansa finally looks up from the fire, eyebrows scrunched together in confusion before her mouth opened, “Jon… You don’t know?”

Jon looked up, just as confused, “Know what?”

“Arya is alive.”

The words stun him, Jon feeling as though someone had just punched him straight through the gut with a war hammer. If his skin wasn’t pale enough already, Sansa could swear he was almost as white as Ghost. Jon’s mind began to slow as if trudging through molasses. How is it possible that his beloved little sister, so fierce and so bright, still be alive in this terrible world… alone?

Jon didn’t know how to react besides leaning forward in his seat, heart squeezing so tightly he thought he’d burst, “Are you sure?”

“Well, I’m not saying I saw her myself. But Brienne told me she found her before she found me.”

“Brienne of Tarth!” Jon called out towards the closed door, where he knew Sansa’s sellsword was standing just outside.

The big woman opens the door and steps inside, closing the door behind her. She bows in greeting, hand always rested on the hilt of her sword, “My lord.”

“My sister says you found Arya,” Jon begins, “And yet she’s not here with us. Did you not swear to Catelyn Stark to keep both of her daughters safe?”

He didn’t mean to sound rude, but it did worry him that Sansa was the only Stark girl Brienne brought back to him, even though she claims to have seen Arya– alive. The sellsword woman nods in confirmation and tries to explain the best she could,

“I did find Arya first. She was traveling with the Hound, Sandor Clegane when I stumbled upon them. Arya didn’t appear to want to come with me, and the Hound didn’t seem keen on letting her go.”

Sansa looks away from Brienne at the mention of Clegane, but either Jon was oblivious or just didn’t care on the matter, “And…? How was she?”

“She looked good. Still small in size but she looked healthy despite the odds,” Brienne assured, “Her hair was cut and she wore trousers, but all the same she appeared unharmed. I fought the Hound and won when I tried protecting her, but she just ran off all the same. She was heading East if I remember correctly, disappearing with her tiny little sword at her side.

“What sword?” Jon’s eyebrows rose, disbelief awoken in his eyes.

“She had a small sword that fit her size, but it was much too thin looking for combat,” Brienne scoffed slightly with a small smile as she remembered it, “She had a silly name for it, too. I barely caught her saying it… What was it…?” She trailed off, trying to will herself to remember.

“Needle,” Jon barely managed to let it out when his throat felt tight and his eyes felt warm when he smiled proudly, “She called it Needle.”

title: War of Hearts
description:
by xxitisbluexx

En la hora del lobo, con un par de copas de vino de por medio, las reinas Arya y Daenerys comparten una charla. AU. Post Guerra.

Words: 1167, Chapters: 1/1, Language: Español

Series: Part 1 of Fire Meets Fate

  • Fandoms: A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms, Game of Thrones (TV)
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Jon Snow | Aegon Targaryen, Arya Stark, Daenerys Targaryen
  • Relationships: Arya Stark/Jon Snow/Daenerys Targaryen, Jon Snow/Arya Stark, Jon Snow/Daenerys Targaryen
  • Additional Tags: R plus L equals J, Queen Daenerys, Queen Arya, King Jon Snow, Targaryen Incest, Post-War, POV Arya Stark
